intro: Ononis sericea, commonly known as silky sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Ononis sericea is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
